text: Sylvia Rose Moy (September 15, 1938 â€“ April 15, 2017) was an American songwriter and record producer. She was associated with the Motown Records group. She was the first woman at the Detroit-based music label to write and produce for Motown acts. Sylvia Moy, Songwriters Hall of Fame . Retrieved 16 April 2017 She is probably best known for her songs written with and for Stevie Wonder. Moy died of complications from pneumonia in Dearborn, Michigan on April 15, 2017, at the age of 78. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Adam White, "Sylvia and Stevie: inspiration and influence" Category:1938 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Infectious disease deaths in Michigan Category:American songwriters Category:Writers from Detroit Category:People from Dearborn, Michigan
title: Sylvia Moy
